intro: Dimeria ornithopoda var. mutica, commonly known as the roughleaf dimeria, is a flowering plant species native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, with branched stems and small, clustered leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically greenish-white and appear in early spring, followed by the production of capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. This species is adapted to drought conditions, showcasing features such as reduced leaf surface area and deep root systems to conserve water.
